claims.claim: The AI Agents market was valued at USD 7.84 billion in 2025 and is projected to grow to USD 52.62 billion by 2030 at a CAGR of 46.3%
The global enterprise agentic AI market was estimated at USD 2.58 billion in 2024 and is projected to reach USD 24.50 billion by 2030
79% of organizations now report AI agent adoption
Approximately 85% of enterprises are expected to implement AI agents by end of 2025
66.4% of implementations use multi-agent system designs rather than single-agent approaches
23% of organizations are scaling agentic AI systems, with additional 39% experimenting with AI agents
Multi-agent systems adoption is expected to grow at CAGR of 44.8% during 2024-2030
claims.notes: Multiple industry reports cite similar growth

claims.claim: OpenAI Swarm is an educational/experimental framework, not production-ready, now replaced by OpenAI Agents SDK
Swarm uses two primary abstractions: Agents and Handoffs, operating statelessly via Chat Completions API
CrewAI raised $18M Series A funding, reached $3.2M revenue by July 2025, with 150+ enterprise customers
CrewAI executes 10 million+ agents per month and is used by nearly half of Fortune 500
claims.notes: Company claim, difficult to independently verify

claims.claim: LangGraph is running in production at LinkedIn, Uber, and 400+ other companies
claims.notes: LangChain company claims with named customers

claims.claim: LangChain team recommends LangGraph for agents over LangChain itself
AutoGen v0.4 adopts actor model architecture for multi-agent systems with event-driven design
MetaGPT achieves 85.9% and 87.7% Pass@1 on code generation benchmarks, 100% task completion rate
MetaGPT defines five roles: product manager, architect, project manager, engineer, QA engineer
Ant Colony Optimization was proposed by Marco Dorigo in 1992 in his PhD thesis
Particle Swarm Optimization was introduced by Kennedy and Eberhart in 1995
Swarm intelligence concept was first proposed in the 1980s
Multi-agent risks report had contributions from 50+ researchers including DeepMind, Anthropic, Carnegie Mellon, Harvard
Three key failure modes identified: miscoordination, conflict, and collusion
75% of tech leaders cite governance as primary deployment challenge for agent systems
Nearly 60% of enterprises cite non-compliance risks and data governance concerns as key adoption barriers
LLM agents exhibit human-like social behaviors including conformity and consensus reaching
AutoGen treats workflows as conversations between agents; LangGraph represents them as graphs with nodes and edges
Coding and Software Development agent role is experiencing fastest adoption in enterprise
North America dominated AI agents market with 39.63% revenue share in 2025
Asia Pacific anticipated to register fastest CAGR for AI agents market
Key challenges include hallucinated plans, premature termination, redundant actions due to limited teammate awareness
AutoGen original creators Chi Wang and Qingyun Wu departed Microsoft in late 2024 to establish AG2 community fork
